author: Special Correspondent
text:
Customs officials at the Kempegowda International Airport on Sunday caught a 52-year-old woman who was allegedly trying to smuggle out 38 gold biscuits concealed around her waist.

The accused, Kunduru Tulasamma, landed at the KIA from an Emirates flight and was getting on a wheelchair hurriedly when she caught the attention of Custom officials. The officials, who kept a watch on her, later found that she had a gunny bag wrapped around her waist concealing 38 gold biscuits worth Rs. 1.2 crore. According to the officials, Tulasamma, a native of Kadapa in Andhra Pradesh, is a carrier in a gold smuggling racket who had gone to Dubai six months ago and had taken up a housekeeping job. She had travelled in business class and was using a wheelchair though she was fit, a senior official said.

Tulasamma said she had been instructed to hand over the consignment to a person waiting outside the airport with her photograph and was promised Rs. 4.5 lakh in cash for the job.

Tulasamma was produced before the court, which remanded her in judicial custody till February 29.
title: Woman trying to smuggle 38 gold biscuits arrested
